page.title: 10THE PUMPING STATION-CUFFLEY.
page.content: The pumping station near Wells Farm was built between 1900 and 1920 and is due to be demolished.It was originally powered by steam, later it was converted to diesel and now it is powered by electricity.It pumps 18700 gallons of water a day,but it is only in use for 11hours a day. They do not have any staff permanently at the pumping station but someone calls in every other day to check everything is alright. The well is 100m deep and 3.5m across. Below 100m there is another 33m bore hole which is only 30cm across.There are two tunnels leading off from the well.One is 200m long and the other is 330m long. These tunnels collect water from different places when there is no water left in the well.There are two cottages near the pumping station used by employees of the Water Board.
